The mere mention of aliens is enough to grab anyone's attention and spark a conversation. It is a topic that is interesting to a wide audience, and it opens up a world of possibilities for discussion. 

Furthermore, the fact that the United Nations appointed an official ambassador to extraterrestrials is intriguing and adds credibility to the topic. It could lead to a debate on whether or not we believe in the existence of aliens, what kind of life forms they could be, and how we would react to their arrival. 

In addition, the response is unexpected and unpredictable, which makes it even more engaging. It is not a common topic that people discuss daily, and it's not something that people would expect to come up in a conversation about the earth's forests or the length of a day. 

In conclusion, the response "do you believe in aliens? the un appointed ambassadors to extraterrestrials" is engaging because it is interesting, unexpected, and opens up a world of possibilities for discussion. topic_chat_history:
hello , did you know that more than 80 % of the earths forests have been destroyed ? 
 that is sad . i hope we can reverse that statistic . 
 yeah that is really sad . i recently read that earth will be helium free by the end of the 21st century . 
 i also think it is interesting that when earth was formed , a day was only 5.5 hours long . i wonder why that changed ? 
 i do n't know , maybe it slowed its rotation eventually ? that 's pretty weird .
topic_chat_fact: in september of 2010 , the united nations appointed official ambassador to extraterrestrials in they case they would ever make contact with earth
topic_chat_response: do you believe in aliens ? the un appointed ambassadors to extraterrestrials .
